p: The median age of the patients was 55 years (IQR 40.0–67.5). Similar age profile was reported in the 2007 outbreak in Italy (median 60 years) [ 6] and in 2017 outbreak in France (range 33–77 years) [ 9]. The increasing prevalence rate of CHIKV infection with increasing age is consistent with other outbreaks, which report lower seroprevalence in children in Italy, in Bagan Panchor, Malaysia, in Mayotte, Indian Ocean and in Managua, Nicaragua [ 19– 22]. Age is a proxy-factor for specific behaviors that cause higher exposure to Ae. albopictus bites (i.e., staying outdoors during daytime) or less tendency toward individual protection (i.e., use of insect repellents) in elder people. Elder people are also more likely to show symptoms and to access to the health structures than young people are [ 22].
